page.title: 10HIGH OXCLOSE FARM-WASHINGTON
page.content: The oldest building in Blackfell Village is High Oxclose Farm. There has been a farm house on the site for over 150 years, although the present house was built about 80 years ago. The owner Mr. Hankey moved there in 1929 from Esh Winning, County Durham and continued to farm until the Washington Development Corporation acquired the land for the building of Blackfell Village in the 1970's Now there is no farm left, the house and large garden are the only reminders of the agricultural past of the area. Originally the area where Blackfell is now situated was called High Oxclose but when the villages were named the area to the north, Black Fell was chosen.
